discourse_list.title: Important notice to all USDP-A users: Collateral offboarding

content.content: Attention USDP-A Users The USDP-A vault type is being offboarded as a result of this proposal by the Risk Core Unit and the accompanying on-chain governance poll approved by MKR holders and delegates.  Timeline USDP-A liquidations have already been activated as a result of the December 4th Executive Vote. The next step will be the complete shutdown and liquidation of all remaining USDP-A vaults via an Executive Vote that will:  Set Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) to 0. Set Liquidation Penalty (chop) to 0%. Set Flat Kick Incentive (tip) to 0. Set Liquidation Ratio (mat) to 1500%.  These offboarding parameters will be included in an upcoming Executive Vote no sooner than February 8th, 2023. Once the offboarding parameters are deployed to the Maker Protocol, all USDP-A positions with a collateralization ratio below 1500% will be liquidated. It should be noted that USDP-A is a standard vault type with a collateralized debt position model that must not be mistaken for the USDP PSM. This offboarding process does not affect any of the PSMs, which are technically named in the Maker Protocol as PSM-USDC-A, PSM-USDP-A, and PSM-GUSD-A.
This topic was automatically closed 14 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
